perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, the Distributor wishes to retain S2K, through registered representatives of S2K (“Authorized S2K Representatives”), to introduce the Funds to registered representatives of broker-dealers and registered investment advisers located at the financial institutions (each, an “Intermediary” and collectively, “Intermediaries”) that may have customers interested in investing in a Fund.
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, ALPS Distributors, Inc. wishes to retain S2K Financial LLC, through registered representatives of S2K (“Authorized S2K Representatives”), to introduce the Funds to registered representatives of broker-dealers and registered investment advisers located at the financial institutions (each, a “Broker” and collectively, “Brokers”) that may have customers interested in investing in a Fund.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Intermediary' is replaced with 'Broker'. The contract now inconsistently uses 'Intermediary' and 'Broker' potentially referring to the same entity without defining them as such, creating confusion about whether these are distinct roles or interchangeable.

perturbation.original_text:
S2K will market the Funds to Intermediaries that:
(a) are registered as “broker-dealers” with the SEC, FINRA, and any other applicable jurisdiction in which they operate and are required to be so registered by law;
(b) will enter into a Selling Agreement agreed to by Distributor and such “broker-dealers,” or in such other form of Intermediary agreement (which shall include, without limitation, broker/dealer Selling Agreements, platform agreements and wirehouse agreements) as required by an Intermediary with the Distributor to sell shares of the Funds to investors (copies of which shall be made available to S2K); and
(c) will sell shares of the Funds through representatives in accordance with the then-current applicable Prospectus and in accordance with the provisions of the Selling Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
S2K will market the Funds to Brokers that:
(a) are registered as “broker-dealers” with the SEC, FINRA, and any other applicable jurisdiction in which they operate and are required to be so registered by law;
(b) will enter into a Selling Agreement agreed to by Distributor and such “broker-dealers,” or in such other form of Referral agreement (which shall include, without limitation, broker/dealer Selling Agreements, platform agreements and wirehouse agreements) as required by a Broker with the Distributor to sell shares of the Funds to investors (copies of which shall be made available to S2K); and
(c) will sell shares of the Funds through representatives in accordance with the then-current applicable Prospectus and in accordance with the provisions of the Selling Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Intermediaries' is replaced with 'Brokers' and 'Intermediary agreement' replaced with 'Referral agreement'. Since both are referenced in the same list it is uncertain as to the distinct nature of the Broker/Referral and Intermediary/agreement relationships and whether the parties must adhere to all or some of the conditions mentioned.

perturbation.original_text:
Each party to this Agreement shall safeguard and hold confidential from disclosure to unauthorized parties all Confidential
Information (as defined below) of the other party or parties. For purposes of this Section 8, the term “Confidential Information” shall mean any and
all information which is in any way connected with, derived from or related to the business of a party, including without limitation, any business
and financial records, any retail or institutional customer information, computer programs, technical data, investment information, lists,
compilations, compositions, programs, plans, devices, descriptions, drawings, methods, techniques, processes, designs, theories concepts or
ideas, and any information relating to the pricing or marketing policies, suppliers or customers of a party.
perturbation.changed_text:
Each party to this Agreement shall safeguard and hold confidential from disclosure to unauthorized parties all Confidential
Information (as defined below) of the other party or parties. For purposes of this Section 8, the term “Confidential Information” shall mean any and
all information which is in any way connected with, derived from or related to the business of a party, including without limitation, any business
and financial records, any retail or institutional client information, computer programs, technical data, investment information, lists,
compilations, compositions, programs, plans, devices, descriptions, drawings, methods, techniques, processes, designs, theories concepts or
ideas, and any information relating to the pricing or marketing policies, suppliers or purchasers of a party.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'customer' is replaced with 'client' and 'suppliers' is replaced with 'purchasers'. This substitution may cause uncertainty in the interpretation of the clause, especially if customers/clients and suppliers/purchasers are defined differently within the financial or legal context relevant to the agreement.
